import {useState} from 'react' const Content = props => { let {Component,selection, state,asset, style, onUpdate} = props let [colas, setColas] = useState([...new Array(200)].map(() => Math.random()*100)) let [colaz, setColaz] = useState([...new Array(200)].map(() => Math.random()*100)) return

Here we proof that the Collatz conjecture is true

} export {Content}
